The claim is false: Australia has built several dams since 1984.
The Australian National Committee on Lar: ANCOLD) maintains a "register of large dams" that lists the newest dams completed in the country.
The Cotter Dam in the Australian Capital: 4. Other newer dams in Australia include the Wyaralong Dam in Queensland, completed in 2011, and the Paradise Dam, built in 2005 for water storage and irrigation purposes.
